basics.name: Brett Speaks
basics.label: Full-stack Software Engineer
basics.summary: Brett is a full-stack software engineer with 13+ years experience. He enjoys tinkering with the latest technologies and the challenge of solving very hard problems in creative ways. In his last job, there several major company projects that were about to be cancelled, and he dove in and re-wrote software that is handles over $60M/month in collections inventory. He has working with dynamic languages better part of the last 5 years working such as python, perl, bash, and Javascript, but he also spent the 10+ years prior working with strongly typed languages such as Java, C#, and C++.

work.summary: D&S specializes in b2b asset recovery and management offering a technological focus not normally found in this business segment. While here, he spent a majority of his time developing and maintaining D&S's cusom b2b credit reporting software as well as taking on a more customer service role interacting with clients or their technical couterparts directly to derrive collection strategys and software requirements surrounding them. He managed some of D&S's largest clients including Dell (Global Float, Global Terms, Tech Direct, DSP, CID, ARB, and DSG), Coke, Barns & Noble College, and ESAB NA.
highlights: Worked remotely with teams in Austin, Lousiana, and Romania on primarly python, Javascript, and perl software development.
Developed and managed infrastructure and app orchestration using SaltStack.
Managed software needs and day to day operations for D&S's large portfolio clients, ex. Dell, Coke, ESAB NA, and Barns & Noble College.
Developed and maintained a b2b credit reporting and portfolio monitoring apps leveraging information provided by Experian and CreditSafe.
Developed VOIP phone, conference, and collection IVR systems using Plivo with graceful fallback to Twillio.
Developed and managed large voice and text blasting campaigns using Aculab Cloud and LiveVox.
Migrated entire company from ActiveDirectory to GSuite.
Managed migration of apps and databases from Texas and Lousiana data centers to Google Cloud infrastructure with nightly deployments across 3 zones.
Managed migration of traditional app structure to Kubernetes with on-demand scaling.

work.summary: Silpada was a home party jewelry sales company started by two women in their basement in Lenex, KS and grown to 45,000 representatives in the US, Canada and UK. While here he was a senior engineer dealing mostly with their homegrown customer service app built on the Netbeans platform and their middle tier business logic which was responsible for persistant order processing, benefit calculations, etc.
highlights: Java, Javascript, JSF, jQuery, JEE, Spring software development.
Principal on Silpada's e-comm site redesign. silpada.com/shop. Lead developer of social network integrations.
Development and maintenance of product and inventory management systems, and order and benefit calculation redesign.
Developed customizable mass emailing applications for repsresentatives.
Implemented online representative signup flows.
Built and administrated JBoss application servers.

work.summary: Lockheed Martin is one of the largest defense contractor in the US. While employed here, I was able to contribute to many of their projects in many different locations.
highlights: C++, C#, and Java software development.
Primary developer of Support Team Status status, Intel Management, and Global Message Processors - Nuclear Planning and Execution System (NPES), Omaha, NE
Developed General Query Tool using MicroStrategy and Oracle BI Discoverer. Lead prototyper of System Health and Status Tool using HP OpenView. - PASSGEAR - Denver, CO
Development of Multi-Level Mission Equipment ICDS and Master Equipment list. - Arerial Common Sensor (ACS) - Littleton, CO
Primary developer for spirals 0 and 1 of the Horizontal Releasability and Request tool. - HIRRT - King of Prussia, PA
